LayoutNode.Content: Architectural Support for Programming Languages and Operating Systems (ASPLOS 2011)
LayoutNode.SRC: Architectural Support for Programming Languages and Operating Systems (ASPLOS 2011)

LayoutNode.Content: The ASPLOS XVI organizing committee is pleased to announce that the ASPLOS XVI conference will be held in California, March 5 ~ 11, 2011.
LayoutNode.SRC: The ASPLOS XVI organizing committee is pleased to announce that the ASPLOS XVI conference will be held in California,  March 5 ~ 11, 2011.

LayoutNode.Content: ASPLOS is a multi-disciplinary conference for research that spans the boundaries of hardware, computer architecture, compilers, languages, operating systems, networking, and applications. ASPLOS provides a high quality forum for scientists and engineers to present their latest research findings in these rapidly changing fields. It has captured some of the major computer systems innovations of the past two decades (e.g., RISC and VLIW processors, small and large-scale multiprocessors, clusters and networks-of-workstations, optimizing compilers, RAID, and network-storage system designs).
LayoutNode.SRC: ASPLOS is a multi-disciplinary conference for research that spans the boundaries of hardware, computer architecture, compilers, languages, operating systems, networking, and applications. ASPLOS provides a high quality forum for scientists and engineers to present their latest research findings in these rapidly changing fields. It has captured some of the major computer systems innovations of the past two decades (e.g., RISC and VLIW processors, small and large-scale multiprocessors, clusters and networks-of-workstations, optimizing compilers, RAID, and network-storage system designs).

LayoutNode.Content: VEE (ACM International Conference on Virtual Execution Environments) will be co-located with ASPLOS'11, March 9~11, 2011.
LayoutNode.SRC: VEE (ACM International Conference on Virtual Execution Environments) will be co-located with ASPLOS'11, March 9~11, 2011.
